titles.title: A joint resolution to establish a national policy on permanent papers.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

bill.summary: 10/11/1988--Introduced. Establishes a national policy that Federal records, books, and publications of enduring value be produced on acid free papers. Directs the Librarian of Congress, the Archivist of the United States, the Director of the National Library of Medicine, and the Administrator of the National Library of Agriculture to jointly monitor and report to the Congress annually on progress in implementing such policy.
